snippet.textDisplay:
Well, nCoV is an epidemic. Tbh if the outbreak was in Africa people would still freak out as we've seen with Ebola, though that disease is far scarier.

The major issue isn't the lethality of the sickness or the lack thereof. It's happening in the heart of the world manufacturing center. If this is to continue we would find systemic shortages of EVERY tech commodity. Already supply chains have been affected and this will continue on. Unless scientists find a cure, which certainly won't happen for at least months, this disruption in trade could cripple the world economy.
